p.s: The novel The Great Gatsby, written by F. Scott Fitzgerald, published in 1925, takes place in New York during the 1920s.
It deals with balancing the pursuit of wealth and the pursuit of love.
The text at hand is an excerpt from the novelsnovel's fifth chapter.
It begins with Daisy arriving at NicksNick's and Nick leading her to his house, where he thinks, Gatsby is waiting.
But Gatsby is absent and knocks at the door, standing in the rain.
Gatsby enters and walks into the room with Daisy, so that Nick can only hear the two.
When Nick walks in, Gatsby knocks a defunctioning clock over.
While Gatsby and Daisy are chatting awkwardly, Nick tries to leave, but Gatsby follows him and expresses his doubt about his plan.
Nick scolds him and tells him to go back in.
When Nick returns, it has stopped raining and the tension between Gatsby and Daisy is gone.
They decide to walk over to Gatsby's.
